response_parsed.title: Observing REST APIs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to utilize the FastAPI framework for building and testing REST APIs in Python 3.12+. It covers creating a simple API, running it, and making requests using a client.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, easy-to-use, and fast web framework for building APIs written in Python.
This guide assumes you have Python 3.12+ installed on your system.
You will need to install FastAPI and Uvicorn (an ASGI server) using pip.
FastAPI provides an intuitive syntax for defining routes, handling HTTP methods, and validating requests.
You can test the API locally by running the script and making requests to its endpoints.
The example provided below includes a simple endpoint that returns a JSON response.
version_notes: Framework: FastAPI (latest version as of writing: FastAPI 0.76.0)
Dependencies: Uvicorn (latest version as of writing: Uvicorn 0.18.0)
caveats: Ensure you have Python 3.12+ installed on your system.
Make sure to install FastAPI and Uvicorn using pip before running the examples.
Update the example code if there are any changes in FastAPI or Uvicorn versions.
